app.introDescription: Processing tool to handle responses from Meta Platforms, Inc. about court-requested IP addresses, specifically via Facebook Records and WhatsApp Records.
app.introInstructions: To use it, provide the file of type ".html" to be processed. After processing, all records responded by the company will be shown as a list, with date and time converted to the selected timezone, and also showing ISP information for each IP address.
app.chartsByDayOfWeek: Records Count by Day of Week
app.footerDevelopedByHTML: Developed by Ítalo Santos | © 2025 | GPL-3.0 License | Hosted on GitHub Pages | Contribute: github.com/italofds/meta-ip-processor
app.securityAlert: Security Notes: All primary processing is done locally in your browser. No sensitive data is sent to external servers. Only IP address queries and map visualization require Internet access. If you still have concerns about data security, try processing the files with the Internet disconnected. For more information, read the Basic Guidelines.

resultAlertComponent.title: Processing Result:
resultAlertComponent.processing: Processing records: this step may take a few seconds, depending on the file size and the client's machine performance.
resultAlertComponent.foundTotal: A total of {total} connection record(s) were found.
resultAlertComponent.checkingProviders: Checking ISPs for unique IP addresses: {success} out of {total}.
resultAlertComponent.errorChecking: An error occurred while checking {errorCount} IP address(es).
